item.description:
Get the most out of your MAP Growth data and reports with this essential professional learning offering. Designed for small groups, this interactive virtual offering will help teachers apply MAP

The post Map Growth – Virtual Applying Reports Professional Learning Fact Sheet appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Get the most out of your MAP Growth data and reports with this essential professional learning offering. Designed for small groups, this interactive virtual offering will help teachers apply MAP Growth RIT scores to develop student goals, inform instructional decisions and engage with parents. These  two sessions are ideal for your first year as a MAP Growth partner.

The post Map Growth – Virtual Applying Reports Professional Learning Fact Sheet appeared first on NWEA.

The post MAP Skills Professional Learning Fact Sheet appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
Whether you’re new to MAP Skills or already apply the data in your instructional programs, our Professional Learning Consultants can help your teachers and intervention specialists deepen their understanding of the reports and personalized instruction. This fact sheet provides more detail about our available onsite and virtual workshops.

The post MAP Skills Professional Learning Fact Sheet appeared first on NWEA.

item.content:encoded:

item.title: Engaging Teachers and Equipping Them to Lead
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
At Somerdale Park School District in New Jersey, the leadership wanted to strengthen teachers’ capacity to track student growth and progress. To do this, they knew the district needed to

The post Engaging Teachers and Equipping Them to Lead appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
At Somerdale Park School District in New Jersey, the leadership wanted to strengthen teachers’ capacity to track student growth and progress. To do this, they knew the district needed to enhance its “ability to accurately assess and accurately drive instruction.” But they also knew that new tools and assessments require teacher engagement, a shared vision, and professional learning support. Read how they are engaging NWEA Professional Learning and data coaching to use MAP Growth data to its fullest potential.

The post Engaging Teachers and Equipping Them to Lead appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: From Below Norms to Above Average – and Still Growing!
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
In 2014, South Bend’s Our Lady of Hungary Catholic School welcomed its third principal in four years: Kevin Goralczyk, an Indiana native and seasoned educator. Together with the parish’s pastor,

The post From Below Norms to Above Average – and Still Growing! appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
In 2014, South Bend’s Our Lady of Hungary Catholic School welcomed its third principal in four years: Kevin Goralczyk, an Indiana native and seasoned educator. Together with the parish’s pastor, Reverend Kevin Bauman, Principal Goralczyk began exploring how Our Lady of Hungary could raise its pre-K–8 student achievement and better support teachers serving a fast-changing school population. The school’s dedication to data-driven instruction and Professional Learning paid off. By the end of their second school year using MAP® Growth, teachers were seeing growth reflected in the scores as well as every day in the classroom.

The post From Below Norms to Above Average – and Still Growing! appeared first on NWEA.

item.title: A High-Achieving District Recommits to High-Quality Assessment Practices
item.dc:creator: Tiffani LeClair
item.description:
After first implementing MAP® Growth™ assessments in 2004, Novi Community School District’s engagement with MAP Growth ebbed and flowed. By the time R.J. Webber joined the district in 2010 as

The post A High-Achieving District Recommits to High-Quality Assessment Practices appeared first on NWEA.
item.content:encoded:
After first implementing MAP® Growth assessments in 2004, Novi Community School District’s engagement with MAP Growth ebbed and flowed. By the time R.J. Webber joined the district in 2010 as Assistant Superintendent of Academic Services, use of MAP Growth data to inform instructional and programmatic decisions was haphazard. As a strong advocate for balanced assessment systems, Webber saw the potential for real-time MAP Growth data to benefit all the district’s students, including its high-achieving majority. Read how they overhauled their curriculum and assessments to use MAP Growth data to its fullest potential.ty.

The post A High-Achieving District Recommits to High-Quality Assessment Practices appeared first on NWEA.
